dxf2svg
Class FigureSheetDatabase

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.Database
      dxf2svg.FigureSheetDatabase
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class FigureSheetDatabase
extends Database

This class is a trivial wrapper for the dxf2svg.util.Database class. It provides method names that are more in tune with the functions we require during the conversion of illustrations.

Here is a view of a typical table as it is stored in the database: 

"1-2-3" <-- Table's name
 -----
   key     eBoardno   fBoardno   eTitle      fTitle    spotcall   total Sht
+-------++----------+----------+---------+-----------+----------+----------+
|  "1"  || g01234ea | g01235fa | "Title" | "Fig nom" | faaabcd  |   "2"    |
+-------++----------+----------+---------+-----------+----------+----------+
|  "2"  || g01236ba | g01236ba | "Title" | "Title"   | faaabce  |   "2"    |
+-------++----------+----------+---------+-----------+----------+----------+

Version:
0.01 - November 13, 2003
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

FigureSheetDatabase

public FigureSheetDatabase()
Default constructor that initializes the database.

Method Detail

addFigureSheetAndValues

public boolean addFigureSheetAndValues(java.lang.String figure,
                                       java.lang.String sheet,
                                       java.lang.String[] boardnos)
Creates a new record on the argument table.

Parameters:
figure - illustration figure number like '1-2-3a'.
sheet - The number of this sheet like 2 of 3 means this is sheet 2.
boardnos - String array of boardnos - from null to 2 usually but not limited to the upper range at all.
Returns:
true requested table and the record was created successfully.

getFigureData

public java.util.Vector getFigureData(java.lang.String figure,
                                      java.lang.String sheet)
This method returns the values stored in a table called tableName by reference of the key argument.

Returns:
Vector of values stored, or alternatively null if the table or record does not exist in the database.

findFigureAndSheetByValue

public java.lang.String[] findFigureAndSheetByValue(java.lang.String value)
This method, when supplied with a data value, will perform a reverse lookup of the Figure and sheet that contains that value. If multipule values are present in the database the first value is returned.

Returns:
String[] , zero indexed with a size of two. The first value is the figure the second is the sheet number (as a string) and may be null if the illustration is a single sheet. May also be null no entry matches 'value'.

deleteSheet

public boolean deleteSheet(java.lang.String figure,
                           java.lang.String sheetNo)
Deletes a sheet from a figure specified by 'figure'.

Returns:
false if the figure does not contain a sheet by the number sheetNo or if the figure does not exist in the database or either figure or sheetNo are null. Returns true otherwise.

deleteFigure

public boolean deleteFigure(java.lang.String figure)
Deletes an entire figure from the database if a figure by the name 'figure' exists.

Returns:
false if the figure does not exist or the argument figure is null. returns true otherwise.

containsFigure

public boolean containsFigure(java.lang.String figure)
Returns true if the key was a valid pointer to data stored in the database.

add

public void add(FigureSheetDatabase f)
Adds the data from the argument FigureSheetDatabase to this FigureSheetDatabase in a safe way. The method for adding the information takes the following form. If a figure from the argument FigureSheetDatabase is already a member of this FigureSheetDatabase then search the sheets adding or replacing as required. If is not a member, then the figures are simply added to this FigureSheetDatabase.

outputXML

public void outputXML(java.io.BufferedWriter bw)
Outputs this object as XML.

Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.io.IOException

for complete description.

convertCharEntities

protected java.lang.String convertCharEntities(java.lang.String s)
Converts any ascii characters greater than 126 to its character entity value.
